meanings.definition: An occurrence of death caused by accident or disease.
meanings.sent1: The car crash resulted in a fatality.
meanings.sent2: The doctor confirmed the fatality of the patient.
meanings.sent3: The fatality of the situation was evident in the somber atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The fatality of the disease spread quickly through the community.
meanings.sent5: The fatality of the accident left a lasting impact on the community.

meanings.definition: The quality of causing death or disaster.
meanings.sent1: The toxicity of the substance posed a fatality risk.
meanings.sent2: The hurricane's strength led to widespread fatality.
meanings.sent3: The fatality of the situation was a harsh reality check.
meanings.sent4: The fatality of the decision was clear in its consequences.
meanings.sent5: The fatality of the virus spread alarm among the population.

meanings.definition: A person who has died in a particular accident or disaster.
meanings.sent1: The rescue team searched for any survivors among the fatalities.
meanings.sent2: The news reported the names of the fatalities in the plane crash.
meanings.sent3: The fatality of the character in the movie shocked the audience.
meanings.sent4: The fatality of the victim was a tragic loss for the family.
meanings.sent5: The fatality of the incident left a void in the community.
